titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I motored to Eardisley, and there attended a meeting of the clergy of the Weobley Rural Deanery. We began with a short service in the Church conducted by the Rural Dean (
): and then we discussed the place of the Holy Communion in the services of Sunday. There were 14 clergy present including
, and all talked, but with no great ability. They are mortally stale through solitude, & lack of adequate employment. After lunch
and I motored to Lyonshall, and called on the Vicar (
) who is about to leave the diocese. Then we went on to Weobley & had tea with M

, an exceptionally attractive lady with a delightful family. She shewed us the fine parish church, and the picturesque village. Then we motored to Hereford. I wrote to Beattie, and to Knight. Also to an inquirer about marriage with a deceased wife's sister.
